thread.title: Canada bucket list places to see
thread.title_full: Canada bucket list places to see

title: Canada bucket list places to see
text:
Canada bucket list places to see Christina Pfeiffer | 24th Jul 2015 3:02 PM Christina Pfeiffer   
If you've been to Canada once or twice you've most likely visited Vancouver. Chances are you've been to Canada on a skiing holiday to Whistler, Big White, Silver Star or Sun Peaks. 
The ski fields of British Columbia and Alberta are packed with Aussies. It feels like almost every second person in Whistler or Silver Star is from Australia. 
Many young Australians head over to Canada's ski fields to work for a season or two. 
You might have visited Jasper National Park and driven along the Icefield Park Way or perhaps you boarded the Rocky Mountaineer and saw the wonderful scenery of the Rocky Mountains from a comfortable seat on the train. 
The Rocky Mountaineer is a splendid train journey through amazing scenery. Sitting back and staring through glass windows at the scenery is such a comfortable way to travel. 
Vancouver, Canada's ski fields and the Rocky Mountains have long been the main drawcards for Australians but Canada has plenty of other attractions too.
